Sure, here are 15 ways to receive resident input:

1. Hold regular town hall meetings where residents can voice their opinions and concerns
2. Use suggestion boxes placed in common areas for residents to submit feedback and ideas anonymously
3. Conduct surveys to gather feedback on specific issues or programs
4. Create a social media group or forum for residents to share their thoughts and ideas
5. Use feedback cards that can be filled out and dropped off at a designated location
6. Create a resident advisory committee made up of residents who can provide ongoing input and feedback
7. Use a suggestion board where residents can post ideas and comments for others to see and respond to
8. Conduct focus groups with small groups of residents to gather more detailed feedback on specific issues
9. Have one-on-one meetings with residents to discuss their individual feedback and concerns
10. Use online polling tools to gather quick feedback on specific topics
11. Host regular events or meetings specifically for resident input and feedback
12. Conduct door-to-door outreach to gather feedback from residents who may not feel comfortable sharing their thoughts publicly
13. Use a mobile app or texting service to collect real-time feedback from residents
14. Host open office hours where residents can drop in to share their thoughts and feedback with leadership
15. Conduct regular check-ins with residents to gather ongoing feedback and make sure their needs are being met.
